texts.definition: Sets of cards used as a unit in a game.
markups: <style="Definition">Sets of cards used as a unit in a game.</style>

Cards are found in many games. <style="CurrentLink">Decks</style> are in many games simply the collection of all cards while in some other games different <style="CurrentLink">Decks</style> exists for different functions or each player have their own <style="CurrentLink">Decks</style>.

All traditional <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Card%20Games">Card Games</link></style>, e.g. <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Contract%20Bridge">Contract Bridge</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Poker">Poker</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Whist">Whist</link></style>, makes use of <style="CurrentLink">Decks</style>. In all these cases they use the same set of 52 cards, while games such as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Bang!">Bang!</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Dominion">Dominion</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Fluxx">Fluxx</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Frank's%20Zoo">Frank's Zoo</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Munchkin">Munchkin</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/No%20Thanks!">No Thanks!</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Race%20for%20the%20Galaxy">Race for the Galaxy</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/The%20Great%20Dalmuti">The Great Dalmuti</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Uno">Uno</link></style> make use of <style="CurrentLink">Decks</style> customized for those games.

<style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Collectible%20Card%20Games">Collectible Card Games</link></style> such as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Hearthstone:%20Heroes%20of%20Warcraft">Hearthstone: Heroes of Warcraft</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Magic:%20The%20Gathering">Magic: The Gathering</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Pok%C3%A9mon%20Trading%20Card%20Game">Pok√©mon Trading Card Game</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Star%20Trek%20Customizable%20Card%20Game">Star Trek Customizable Card Game</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Illuminati:%20New%20World%20Order">Illuminati: New World Order</link></style> also make use of <style="CurrentLink">Decks</style>, but in this case each player creates (or is assigned) his or her own <style="CurrentLink">Deck</style> to play with. Deck Building games such as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Dominion">Dominion</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Legendary:%20A%20Marvel%20Deck%20Building%20Game">Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/The%20Lord%20of%20the%20Rings:%20The%20Fellowship%20of%20the%20Ring%20Deck-Building%20Game">The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring Deck-Building Game</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Thunderstone">Thunderstone</link></style> function in the same way, but here players expand their <style="CurrentLink">Decks</style> during gameplay.

The design of how <style="CurrentLink">Decks</style> are used in games rely primarily on deciding which <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> can be used. A secondary choice is how many <style="CurrentLink">Decks</style> should be used, e.g. should each player have their own <style="CurrentLink">Decks</style>? <style="Link"><link="deck-building">Deck Building</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Pre-Customized%20Decks">Pre-Customized Decks</link></style> allow players to construct the <style="CurrentLink">Decks</style> used and is very often used when players have their own <style="CurrentLink">Decks</style>. The use of these patterns in <style="Link"><link="collectible-card-games">Collectible Card Games</link></style> make <style="CurrentLink">Decks</style> a common occurrence in this type of games.

Each <style="CurrentLink">Deck</style> in a game can be design as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Closed%20Economies">Closed Economies</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Faucet/Drain">Faucet/Drain</link></style> systems, with <style="Link"><link="deck-building">Deck Building</link></style> as the primary way to design the latter choice. The most common use of <style="CurrentLink">Decks</style> is as <style="Link"><link="drawing-stacks">Drawing Stacks</link></style>, often to let players create <style="Link"><link="hands">Hands</link></style>. This can be modified by <style="Link"><link="drafting-spreads">Drafting Spreads</link></style> that let players choose which <style="Link"><link="cards">Card</link></style> from a limited set they wish to take. <style="Link"><link="discard-piles">Discard Piles</link></style> are typically used whenever the number of <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> in <style="CurrentLink">Decks</style> are not sufficient for the intended gameplay time or when re-use of <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> for new <style="Link"><link="drawing-stacks">Drawing Stacks</link></style> are intended; this creates true <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Closed%20Economies">Closed Economies</link></style> if no new <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> are introduced and lets new <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> be randomized with the old ones when <style="Link"><link="deck-building">Deck Building</link></style> is used (since new <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> are typically placed in <style="Link"><link="discard-piles">Discard Piles</link></style>).

<style="CurrentLink">Decks</style> provide <style="Link"><link="randomness">Randomness</link></style> for games using <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style>. Keeping track of which <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> are left in <style="CurrentLink">Decks</style> often provide gameplay advantage and because of this the presence of <style="CurrentLink">Decks</style> encourage <style="Link"><link="memorizing">Memorizing</link></style>. It can also provide <style="Link"><link="strategic-knowledge">Strategic Knowledge</link></style> either when players know which <style="Link"><link="cards">Cards</link></style> are in <style="CurrentLink">Decks</style> or when they can create them through <style="Link"><link="deck-building">Deck Building</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Pre-Customized%20Decks">Pre-Customized Decks</link></style>.
